description: Nanami Takahashi welcomes the start of her high school life with great expectations of making as many friends as possible. There is much talk among the girls about a popular boy, Motoharu Yano, who has 2/3 of the girls in his middle school liking him. When Nanami asks Yuri Yamamoto, the girl sitting next to her, about Yano, the latter curtly replies that she dislikes him. Nanami is clueless of who Yano is until the day of the class nomination when she made a fool of herself by calling the name of her new friend wrongly. It turns out that she has actually met Yano along the corridors (unaware of his true identity) and he tricked her by providing a random name, resulting in the embarrassing incident in class. Nanami was initially mad at Yano but after a few encounters with him, she begins to find herself liking him.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

node.description:
[Blog](http://ameblo.jp/19830219/) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/nozooooo)

Birth name: Nozomi (望) Sasaki (佐々木)     About:  Changed her name to all-hiragana form because the kanji of her birth name was exactly the same as voice actor Nozomu Sasaki's (望 can be pronounced either as "Nozomu" or "Nozomi").
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/安部純)

__Birth place:__ Hokkaido, Japan
__Gender:__ Female

Yuki Obata's debut manga, Raindrops, won the Shogakukan Shinjin Comics Taisho Kasaku Award in 1998. Her current series, We Were There (Bokura ga Ita), won the 50th Shogakukan Manga Award and was adapted into an animated television series.

[Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Noboru_Ishiguro) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/石黒昇)

Noboru Ishiguro was noteworthy for directing classic anime series like [Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088/), [Orguss](https://anilist.co/anime/2089/) and [Legend of the Galactic Heroes](https://anilist.co/anime/820/).

He was in a Hawaiian-style music band in his youth. Therefore, he is known as an animation director who can actually read musical scores and has made the best use of his previous experience for works such as [Macross: Do You Remember Love?](https://anilist.co/anime/1089/) and Legend of the Galactic Heroes. He entered Nihon University in the Department of Art and graduated in 1964. He joined Onishi Pro where he first worked as a key animator on subcontracted Astro Boy episodes. In 1978, he founded [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/) for which he served as an executive director until he passed away in 2012.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/akitaroh_le) | [Website](http://www5c.biglobe.ne.jp/~akitaroh/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大地丙太郎)

He is a Tokyo Polytechnic University graduate. Although Daichi was an aspiring stage photographer he instead joined animation photography company Tokyo Animation Film where he continued to work for 5 years, although he temporarily changed jobs and shot live-action karaoke videos instead. In 1991 he left his employer, worked at a game production for half a year, and returned to the animation industry where he would study under animation director [Tetsuo Yasumi](https://anilist.co/staff/111207/). Daichi would advance into episode direction and caught the eyes of [Tatsuo Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/100391/) and [Hiroaki Sakurai](https://anilist.co/staff/101153/) who were impressed with his work on [*Akazukin Chacha*](https://anilist.co/anime/103/Akazukin-Chacha). Daichi made his solo directorial debut in 1995 with [*Nurse Angel Ririka SOS*](https://anilist.co/anime/616/Nurse-Angel-Ririka-SOS). Since 2015 he serves as scriptwriter and director for [*Kodomo no Omocha*](https://anilist.co/anime/1486/Kodomo-no-Omocha/)'s stage version of which he directed the anime as well. Presently he's a freelance director.

**Style**
He specializes in high-tension comedy and often includes comedy and lighthearted moments even in more serious works. In his comedies he often smoothly deforms the characters far beyond their design, inspired by gag manga king [Fujio Akatsuka](https://anilist.co/staff/97141/). His directing work tends to include live-action images or brief flashbacks from past episodes. Since childhood Daichi became affected and inspired by the works of famous jidaigeki actor *Joushirou Konoe* inspiring him to make more historical samurai works.

Daichi is particular about choosing voice actors and has discovered several talents such as [Ayaka Saitou](https://anilist.co/staff/95222/), [Nozomi Sasaki](https://anilist.co/staff/95580/), and [Reiko Yasuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/95373/). 

**Accolades**
- [*Ojarumaru*](https://anilist.co/anime/4459/Ojarumaru) won the 1999 Japan Media Arts Festival Animation Excellence Award.
- [*Maksete Iruka!*](https://anilist.co/anime/2791/Makasete-Iruka/) won the 2004 Japan Media Arts Festival Animation Excellence Award.
- [*Gyagu Manga Biyori*](https://anilist.co/anime/1196/Gyagu-Manga-Biyori) was recommended by the Japan Media Arts Festival Animation committee in 2005.

**Controversies**
In 2018 and 2019 voice actress [Hiroko Konishi](https://anilist.co/staff/96545/Hiroko-Konishi) alleged that she was propositioned by her manager to enter a mixed bath with Daichi in the nude and was blacklisted from the voice acting industry when she refused.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/akitaroh_le) | [Website](http://www5c.biglobe.ne.jp/~akitaroh/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大地丙太郎)

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mill_sister)** | **[Website (blog)](https://blog.goo.ne.jp/gooussy)**

Kiyoko Sayama is a Japanese director, episode director, animation director and storyboard artist.

Married to [Tetsuya Kumagai](https://anilist.co/staff/101548/Tetsuya-Kumagai).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/たなかかずや)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jetikariya50)

Acknowledged internationally for his work on [Yu☆Gi☆Oh!](https://anilist.co/anime/481/) and [Death Note](https://anilist.co/anime/1535/).

Famous for his depictions of fingers and the "Joey Chin" in Yu-Gi-Oh!.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/589238508)

Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/), currently affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/589238508)

Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/), currently affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).
**Shimizu Tomoyuki (清水友幸)** is a Japanese art director and background artist.
[Website](http://hitoikizaka.com) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/武藤星児)
[Website](http://hitoikizaka.com) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/武藤星児)

[1st Twitter](https://twitter.com/NishiiTerumi) | [2nd Twitter](https://twitter.com/Nishiiterumi1) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/teruminishii.bsky.social) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCRVXG5v77o6zvzBxb9NxffQ) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/terumi_nishii/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=17680136) | [Website](http://studio-meiris.com/)

Initially wanting to become a mangaka, it wasn't until while studying at Osaka Designers' College that Ishii thought about becoming an animator after having seen [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/), a show directed by [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/). Shortly thereafter a re-telling movie for the series was announced and Nishii set her sights on being part of the production. After graduating she joined Studio Cockpit and managed to make her debut on the film as an in-betweener.

In 2011, she made her debut as a character designer on [Penguindrum](https://anilist.co/anime/10721/), another show of Ikuhara's.
Made his directorial debut with [Katekyou Hitman Reborn!](https://anilist.co/anime/1604/), in which he storyboarded half of the episodes.
Made his directorial debut with [Katekyou Hitman Reborn!](https://anilist.co/anime/1604/), in which he storyboarded half of the episodes.
Made his directorial debut with [Katekyou Hitman Reborn!](https://anilist.co/anime/1604/), in which he storyboarded half of the episodes.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ushimou730) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/馬越嘉彦)

A highly prolific and respected character designer.

Originating from Monsieur Onion, where he spent his in-betweening days studying under [Hirotoshi Takaya](https://anilist.co/staff/117473/) and [Junichi Hayama](https://anilist.co/staff/140660/). In 1991, he moved to Studio Cockpit with [Hisashi Kagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120432/) and [Tatsufumi Tamakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/109607/). A few years later he debuted as a character designer on [Grappler Baki](https://anilist.co/anime/1859/) in 1994.

He is said to be a very fast and efficient worker, and according to himself, he much rather participates in TV productions than theatrical ones. Close friends with [Hiroshi Nagahama](https://anilist.co/staff/99346/) whom he often works with. They first worked together on [Juubei-chan 2](https://anilist.co/anime/636/), for which Umakoshi provided the designs for and served as the chief animation director on all 13 episodes. The following year, the duo teamed up again for [Mushishi](https://anilist.co/anime/457/), which's production quality was unusually high for a TV production. Umakoshi designed the characters and worked as the chief animation director on all 26 episodes of the series and hit a burn-out. After this he took a step back on major roles for a few years. Both him and Nagahama reprised their roles on Mushishi's revival in 2014.

In 2016, Umakoshi was appointed as the character designer on [My Hero Academia](https://anilist.co/anime/21459/), and has since been highly involved with the series' production as both an animation director and animator.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/141121934) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/akemi_h_0808/) | [Blog](http://replica08.web.fc2.com/index.html)
